query: What are the fluorescent dyes being used in this image if any? Please specify which organelles are being stained and why?
expected_answer: Generic DAPI, GFP, and rhodamine dyes. The specific organelles are hard to decipher here due to the advancement of apoptosis occurring here.

query: Do the cells in these images seem healthy? If not, what is the process they could undergo and how would you know?
expected_answer: These cells are pretty much dead, we can even start seeing some photobleaching.

query: Do you notice any morphological changes present in these images? If so what types and to what ratio are you able to compare puncta to filamentous networks?

These images have two pathways, one showing the basics of staining to certain organelles while others show invasion. What is being invaded into these cells? Which organelles are these morphology changes occurring in these images?
How many of the cells in these images are undergoing cell death? Give me a number.
What are the fluorescent dyes being used in this image if any? Please specify which organelles are being stained and why?
expected_answer: GFP (green fluorescent protein) to label the ER and rhodamine protein to label the virus invasion.

query: Do the cells in these images seem healthy? If not, what is the process they could undergo and how would you know?
expected_answer: Cells are not healthy; they are beginning to bleb and swell. The ER is also beginning to swell. Here, we can see the invasion stays in tact while the cell begins to break down.

query: Do you notice any morphological changes present in these images? If so what types and to what ratio are you able to compare puncta to filamentous networks?
expected_answer: Yes there are morphology changes, mostly puncta and blebbing.

query: These images have two pathways, one showing the basics of staining to certain organelles while others show invasion. What is being invaded into these cells? Which organelles are these morphology changes occurring in these images?
expected_answer: Apoptosis is being undergone with these cells and viruses are being invaded.

query: How many of the cells in these images are undergoing cell death? Give me a number.
What are the fluorescent dyes being used in this image if any? Please specify which organelles are being stained and why?
expected_answer: Blue fluorescence is Hoechst 33258 is staining the nucleus.  Alexa 594 red fluorescence is staining the mitochondria in the cell.

query: Do the cells in these images seem healthy? If not, what is the process they could undergo and how would you know?
expected_answer: These cells healthy and showing nicely stained mitochondria throughout the cytoplasm, we can see this due to their elongated shapes.

expected_answer: This image does not show any outstanding morphological changes to the organelles present in the cell. The cell seems healthy and properly stained.
